page.title: 14WHATS CHANGED IN THE VILLAGE
page.content: College Farm was a working farm up to 20 years ago.The house I now live in was once part of the orchard &the garden is where the poultry were kept. Flamstead School is built on part of the farmland,also Pye Gardens & College Close.Four farm cotteges by the school were pulled down & a chapel was built.Trowley Bottom chapel was sold & used as a private house.Trowley Bottom once had a shop at the top of the hill but it closed over 30 years ago.Bell Cottage was once an Inn. Legend has it that Dick Turpin stayed there.Later it became a shop until about 25 years ago.What is now the butchers was once a bakery during the same period.The one building that has remained over the last 900 years is St. Leonards Paris Church,built of flint and brick,partly from Verulamium.
